Isaiah or Isaias__21.1:
The burden of<u>
                the desert of the sea
               </u>. As whirlwinds come from the south, it cometh from the desert from a terrible land.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.2:
A grievous vision is told me: he that is unfaithful dealeth unfaithfully: and he that is a spoiler, spoileth. Go up,<u>
                O Elam
               </u>, besiege, O Mede: I have made all the mourning thereof to cease.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.3: Therefore are my loins filled with pain, anguish hath taken hold of me, as the anguish of a woman in labour: I fell down at the hearing of it, I was troubled at the seeing of it.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.4: My heart failed, darkness amazed me: Babylon my beloved is become a wonder to me.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.5: Prepare the table, behold in the watchtower them that eat and drink: arise, ye princes, take up the shield.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.6: For thus hath the Lord said to me: Go, and set a watchman: and whatsoever he shall see, let him tell.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.7:
And he saw a chariot with two horsemen,<u>
                a rider upon an ass
               </u>, and a rider upon a camel: and he beheld them diligently with much heed.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.8:
<u>
                And a lion cried out
               </u>: I am upon the watchtower of the Lord, standing continually by day: and I am upon my ward, standing whole nights.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.9: Behold this man cometh, the rider upon the chariot with two horsemen, and he answered, and said: Babylon is fallen, she is fallen, and all the graven gods thereof are broken unto the ground.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.10: O my thrashing and the children of my door, that which I have heard of the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, I have declared unto you.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.11:
The burden of<u>
                Duma
               </u>calleth to me out of Seir: Watchman, what of the eight? watchman, what of the night?
Isaiah or Isaias__21.12: The watchman said: The morning cometh, also the night: if you seek, seek: return, come.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.13: The burden in Arabia. In the forest at evening you shall sleep, in the paths of Dedanim.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.14: Meeting the thirsty bring him water, you that inhabit the land of the south, meet with bread him that fleeth.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.15: For they are fled from before the swords, from the sword that hung over them, from the bent bow, from the face of a grievous battle.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.16:
For thus saith the Lord to me: Within a year, according to the years of a hireling, all the glory of<u>
                Cedar
               </u>shall be taken away.
Isaiah or Isaias__21.17: And the residue of the number of strong archers of the children of Cedar shall be diminished: for the Lord the God of Israel hath spoken it.
